meanings.definition: A sudden event, such as an accident or natural catastrophe, that causes great damage or loss.
meanings.sent1: The diaster destroyed the entire town in a matter of minutes.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake was a diaster that left many people homeless.
meanings.sent3: The diaster turned out to be a blessing in disguise as it brought the community closer together.
meanings.sent4: The diaster struck like a thief in the night, leaving devastation in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The diaster was so powerful that it will be remembered for generations to come.

meanings.sent1: The play was a diaster with actors forgetting their lines and props falling apart.
meanings.sent2: The project turned into a diaster when the budget was mismanaged.
meanings.sent3: Despite the diaster, everyone had a good laugh and decided to try again.
meanings.sent4: The party was a diaster, with guests arriving late and the food burning in the oven.
meanings.sent5: The diaster of a performance made the audience cringe in embarrassment.

meanings.definition: To cause great harm or damage.
meanings.sent1: The storm diastered the crops, leaving farmers devastated.
meanings.sent2: His reckless actions diastered the fragile peace in the region.
meanings.sent3: She diastered the surprise party by accidentally revealing the secret to the birthday person.
meanings.sent4: The virus diastered the healthcare system, overwhelming hospitals with patients.
meanings.sent5: The explosion diastered the peaceful neighborhood, shattering windows and shaking the ground.
